West-of-Hudson Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Friday, Sept. 2- Monday, Sept. 5)

You shouldn't have to work hard to celebrate Labor Day! We've got plenty of service to get you where you need to go for the entire holiday weekend (Sept. 2-Sept. 5). On Friday, Sept 2 look for early getaway service on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, September 3 & Sunday, September 4, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 5, Labor Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See full details at http://bit.ly/1sXkvxu
Metro-North Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Friday, Sept. 2- Monday, Sept. 5)

You shouldn't have to work hard to celebrate Labor Day! Metro-North has plenty of trains to get you to your destinations during the long holiday weekend (Sept. 2 - Sept. 5). On Friday, Sept. 2, we have early Getaway trains starting at 1 PM. On Saturday, Sept. 3 & Sunday, Sept. 4, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 5, Labor Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect. See full details at http://bit.ly/1kY170N

West-of-Hudson Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Friday, Sept. 2- Monday, Sept. 5)

You shouldn't have to work hard to celebrate Labor Day! We've got plenty of service to get you where you need to go for the entire holiday weekend (Sept. 2-Sept. 5). On Friday, Sept 2 look for early getaway service on the Port Jervis & Pascack Valley lines. On Saturday, September 3 & Sunday, September 4, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 5, Labor Day, a weekend schedule will be in effect on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley Lines. An extra afternoon inbound train will depart Port Jervis at 4:09 p.m., making all stops through Suffern, then run express to Secaucus Junction and Hoboken. Customers wishing to travel to Penn Station-NY should transfer at Secaucus Junction. See full details at http://bit.ly/1sXkvxu
Metro-North Labor Day Holiday Weekend Service (Friday, Sept. 2- Monday, Sept. 5)

You shouldn't have to work hard to celebrate Labor Day! Metro-North has plenty of trains to get you to your destinations during the long holiday weekend (Sept. 2 - Sept. 5). On Friday, Sept. 2, we have early Getaway trains starting at 1 PM. On Saturday, Sept. 3 & Sunday, Sept. 4, a regular weekend schedule will be in effect. On Monday, Sept. 5, Labor Day, a Sunday schedule will be in effect. See full details at http://bit.ly/1kY170N

LIRR Service to The Barclays at Bethpage Black Today

For golf fans heading to The Barclays at Bethpage Black this weekend, LIRR eastbound train service to Farmingdale departs from Penn Station, Woodside, Jamaica, Mineola & Hicksville. Connecting service available from Brooklyn. Those traveling to The Barclays PGA TOUR Event from eastern Long Island have direct LIRR service to Farmingdale from Ronkonkoma, Central Islip, Brentwood, Deer Park & Wyandanch. Free shuttle bus services runs between the LIRR's Farmingdale Station and Bethpage State Park.

MTA eTix Now Available on All LIRR Branches

MTA eTix, the LIRR's new mobile ticketing app, is now available for use on ALL LIRR branches. Mobile ticketing lets you buy and use train tickets directly from your mobile devices anytime, anywhere. Simply download the free MTA eTix app on iPhone or Android. Purchase your ticket in advance of travel. Then, ACTIVATE your ticket on the app JUST BEFORE YOU BOARD THE TRAIN so you can display it to the conductor.

WEEKEND TUBE CLOSURES AT QUEENS MIDTOWN TUNNEL FOR REPAIR WORK: AUGUST 26 - 29, 2016

The Manhattan-bound (north) tube of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for necessary repair work on Friday, August 26, 2016, from 11:00 p.m. through Sunday, August 28 until 8:00 a.m. One lane will remain open in each direction in the other tube during this period. The Queens-bound (south) tube of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed this Sunday, August 28, 2016, from 10:00 p.m. through Monday, August 29 at 5:30 a.m., to accommodate ongoing Superstorm Sandy restoration work. One lane will remain open in each direction in the other tube during this period. Motorists should allow extra time and may wish to use an alternate route if possible.
LIRR Cannonball Express Service to Hamptons

The Cannonball, the LIRR's non-stop express train to the Hamptons operates today, departing Penn Station at 4:06 PM. All luggage MUST fit in the overhead rack or under the seat. Luggage MUST not block aisles or doors. Please listen to announcements or check departure boards for final track assignment. Hamptons Reserve customers on the Cannonball please board on the first three cars of the train. If departing from Track 19, use the staircase to the left of the last LIRR ticket window. Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, on Weekends through Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf

West-of-Hudson Weekend Delays of 10 to 15-Minutes Aug. 13-14 due to Track Work at Hoboken

On Saturday, August 13 and Sunday, August 14 from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m., Port Jervis & Pascack Valley Line customers may experience service delays between 10-15 minutes in both directions at Hoboken Station due to NJ TRANSIT track work. Please allow for extra travel time. We thank you for your patience during this service improvement. If you have any questions, please call NJ TRANSIT Customer Service at (973) 275-5555 between 8:30 a.m. and 5 p.m. daily.
Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, on Weekends through Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf

Substitute Busing on New Canaan Branch, on Weekends through Aug. 21

Substitute busing will be provided between New Canaan and Stamford stations for select trains on Fridays, and for all trains on Saturdays and Sundays through August 21. Note: Buses will operate 15 to 20 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check local or express bus service to your destination when boarding. Service changes will allow for renewal work on grade crossings. We appreciate your patience during this infrastructure improvement. To see the full schedule, click here http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/NewCanaanBus_714.pdf

LIRR Cannonball Express Service to Hamptons

The Cannonball, the LIRR's non-stop express train to the Hamptons operates today, departing Penn Station at 4:06 PM. All luggage MUST fit in the overhead rack or under the seat. Luggage MUST not block aisles or doors. Please listen to announcements or check departure boards for final track assignment. Hamptons Reserve customers on the Cannonball please board on the first three cars of the train. If departing from Track 19, use the staircase to the left of the last LIRR ticket window. See map at http://web.mta.info/lirr/hamptons/HamptonsReservePennMap.jpg

Weekday Reverse Peak Busing at Philipse Manor & Scarborough Begins August 1

Beginning August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. During these times, customers will connect with shuttle buses at Tarrytown station for travel to/from Philipse Manor and Scarborough. See full details on busing at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 This change is being done to accommodate construction work related to our Superstorm Sandy Recovery effort.

Due to switch problems at Mets-Willets Point, there is no 7 train service between Flushing-Main St and Mets-Willets Pt. As alternative customers are advised to use the Q48 bus service making nearby stations stops. Allow additional travel time.
Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments Effective August 1

Minor schedule adjustments will be made on the Hudson and Harlem lines on Monday, August 1. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments Effective August 1

Minor schedule adjustments will be made on the Hudson and Harlem lines on Monday, August 1. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk
Weekday Reverse Peak Busing at Philipse Manor & Scarborough Begins August 1

Beginning August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. During these times, customers will connect with shuttle buses at Tarrytown station for travel to/from Philipse Manor and Scarborough. See full details on busing at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 This change is being done to accommodate construction work related to our Superstorm Sandy Recovery effort.

Weekday Reverse Peak Busing at Philipse Manor & Scarborough Begins August 1

As of August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. During these times, customers will connect with shuttle buses at Tarrytown station for travel to/from Philipse Manor and Scarborough. See full details on busing at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 This change is being done to accommodate construction work related to our Superstorm Sandy Recovery effort.
Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments

Minor schedule adjustments have been made on the Hudson and Harlem lines. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

Minor Hudson and Harlem Line Schedule Adjustments Effective August 1

Minor schedule adjustments will be made on the Hudson and Harlem lines on Monday, August 1. On the Hudson Line, due to continued progress on the Sandy Resiliency Project, changes will include substitute bus service at Philipse Manor and Scarborough during AM Reverse Peak and PM Reverse Peak periods. See busing details at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 . On the Harlem Line, the 6:45 AM train from Southeast to Grand Central will now depart Southeast at 6:42 AM. After Goldens Bridge, the train will follow its current schedule, with no change to the arrival time at Grand Central Terminal. There are no service changes on the New Haven Line. See more schedule details at http://bit.ly/2afBPLj New timetables are available in Grand Central, at outlying stations, or view our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk
Weekday Reverse Peak Busing at Philipse Manor & Scarborough Begins August 1

Beginning August 1, certain weekday "reverse peak" trains will not stop at Philipse Manor and Scarborough stations. During these times, customers will connect with shuttle buses at Tarrytown station for travel to/from Philipse Manor and Scarborough. See full details on busing at http://bit.ly/29WMpV0 This change is being done to accommodate construction work related to our Superstorm Sandy Recovery effort.
